titlegrp.title: Fluorinated hydroquinones via annulation of fluorovinylcarbene complexes with alkynes

abstract.p: Pentacarbonyl[(E)-2,3-difluoro-1-methoxyhept-2-en-1-ylidene]chromium, accessible in few steps from the industrial monomer chlorotrifluoroethene viathe classical Fischer procedure, reacts with diphenylacetylene to give 2-n-butyl-3-fluoro-4-methoxy-5,6-diphenylphenol in an unprecedented tandem carbene annulation-efluorination process.

section.p: .r. CHEM. SOC. CHEM. COMMUN. r993 Fluorinated Hydroquinones via Annulation of Fluorovinylcarbene Complexes with Alkynesl Karl Heinz Dotz*t and Jorg Glanzer Fachbereich der Philipps-Universitat Hans-Meerwein-Strasse 0-3550Marburg Germany Pentacarbonyl[(€)-2,3-difluoro-l-methoxyhept-2-en-l -ylidenelchromium accessible in few steps from the industrial monomer chlorotrifluoroethene via the classical Fischer procedure reacts with diphenylacetylene to give 2-n-butyl-3-fluoro-4-methoxy-5,6-diphenylphenol in an unprecedented tandem carbene annulation-defluorination process. Fischer-type carbonyl carbene complexes have been establi- shed as valuable synthons in organic synthesis based on either metal or ligand centred C-C bond formation.2 The most valuable reaction so far turned out to be the chromium- mediated carbene annulation a stepwise formal [3 + 2 + 11 cycloaddition of an a$-unsaturated carbene ligand an alkyne t Present address Institut fur Organische Chemie und Biochemie Universitat Bonn Gerhard-Domagk-Strasse 1 D 53121 Bonn Germany.

and a carbonyl ligand to form Cr( C0)3-coordinated hydroxy- arenes.3 If alkoxy(viny1)carbene ligands such as in A are utilized in this process generally two different types of products B and C are to be expected depending on the vinyl substitution pattern (Scheme 1).Given that a (3-H substituent is present in the vinyl group a phenol C results from a fast tautomerization of the annulation intermediate B whereas the cyclohexadienone usually can be isolated if the P-position is blocked by alkyl groups.4 We were interested in applying this strategy to construct fluorinated six-membered ring analogues from hitherto un- J.

CHEM. SOC. CHEM. COMMUN. 1993 R' R2 A 0-OH B C Scheme 1 OMe 1 2 3 Scheme 2 Reagents and conditions i Cr(C0)6 tetrahydrofuran (THF) -30 "C 3 h Me30BF4 CH2Cl2; ii PhGCPh (1.5 equiv.) BufOMe 55 "C 18 h FeC13 dimethylformamide known fluorovinylcarbene complexes. Whereas the addition of fluorovinyllithium reagents to organic electrophiles is well documented,5-10 the reaction with hexacarbonylchromium as an organometallic electrophile turned out to be very sensitive to the vinyl substitution pattern in particular to the substitu- ent trans to lithium. For instance (E)-172-difluorohex-l- enyllithium 16 added smoothly to Cr(C0)6 and after alkyl- ation with Me30BF4 gave carbene complex 2$ in moderate yield (Scheme 2) while both trifluorovinyllithium and anal- ogues bearing a sterically demanding trans substituent (But SiMe3) failed to add under various conditions.

On warming the difluorovinylcarbene complex 2 in ButOMe under reflux in the presence of 1.5 equiv. of diphenylacetylene a carbene annulation occurs and after oxidation and chromatographic workup the monofluorohy- droquinone monoether 3$ was isolated in moderate yield $ Selected spectroscopic data 2 IR (Et20) vco/cm-l 2065m 1985sh and 1959vs; lH NMR (400 MHz CD3COCD3) 6 4.89 (s 3H OCH3) 6.9 3 ~~ 2.53 (ddt 2H 3JHF 23.2 4J~~ J 6.9 HZ zCF-CH~) 1.64 (quint.

2H 3J 7.5 Hz Ar-CH2-CH2-) 1.45 (sext. 2H 3J 7.2 Hz -CH2-CH3) 0.98 (t 3H 3J 7.2 Hz CH3); 13C NMR (100.6 MHz CD3COCD3) 6 154.4(d lJc~244 HZ C-3) 147.2(d 3Jc~9.2 Hz,C-I) 138.8(d,2Jc~ 12.8 HZ C-4) 133.3 (d 4Jc~2.7 Hz C-6) Hz C-5) 122.7 (d,4J~~3.4 117.4 (d 'JCF 18.2HZ C-2) 135.8 (d 4Jc~2.9Hz C-l') 134.6 (C-1") 131.0 130.5 (C-3' C-3" C-5' C-5") 128.9 127.3 (C-2' C-2" 2 -0 Ph,@:] .. -Ph F-Ph OMe OMe I I1 y II1 ?H Ph OM0 3 Scheme 3 Proposed mechanism for the formation of 3 (Scheme 2). The formation of 3 can be rationalized in terms of the generally accepted mechanism for carbene annulation involving chromium-coordinated dienylketene and cyclohex- adienone intermediates I and I1 (Scheme 3).2 We suggest that the striking and unprecedented cleavage of a C-F bond ato a carbonyl group is facilitated by a redox process generating the phenolate I11 and an uncoordinated Cr*I-species.

Interestingly and in contrast to the vast majority of chromium-mediated carbene annulation reactions studied in our group no Cr(C0)3 complex of 3 could be detected even under strictly non-oxidative conditions. Support from the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (SFB 260) from the Fonds der Chemischen Industrie and from E. Merck Darmstadt is gratefully acknowledged.
